alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Comanche; Cotton; Garvin; Grady; Jefferson; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 9:30PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Comanche, northwestern Jefferson, western Garvin, Grady, Stephens, southwestern Lincoln, Oklahoma, eastern Cotton, Cleveland, southeastern Canadian, northwestern Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 1000 PM CST... At 928 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers along a line extending from near Blanchard to 5 miles southwest of Rush Springs to 3 miles southeast of Burkburnett. Movement was northeast at 75 mph. Strong wind gusts will occur with many of these showers. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oklahoma City, Norman, southern Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Duncan, Del City, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Marlow, Walters, Waurika, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, The Village and Noble. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 83 and 141. Interstate 40 between mile markers 141 and 180. Interstate 44 between mile markers 7 and 19, and between mile markers 73 and 152. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Canadian; Cleveland; Comanche; Cotton; Garvin; Grady; Jefferson; Lincoln; McClain; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie; Stephens
